list.title: Daily Logs Tour
list.description: Learn how to manage and track daily water treatment logs

welcome.title: Welcome to Daily Logs!
welcome.content: Daily logs are where you record field measurements and laboratory results for your water treatment systems. Let's explore how to manage them effectively!

header.title: Daily Logs Page
header.content: This page shows all your daily logs - both field measurements and laboratory analysis. You can view, filter, and export your records from here.

viewMode.title: View Mode Toggle
viewMode.content: Switch between table view (detailed list) and chart view (visual graphs) to analyze your data in different ways. Perfect for spotting trends!

export.title: Export Your Data
export.content: Export your daily logs to PDF, HTML, or CSV format for reports, compliance documentation, or offline analysis.

newLog.title: Create New Log
newLog.content: Click here to record a new daily log - either field measurements taken on-site or laboratory analysis results.

filters.title: Filter Your Logs
filters.content: Use filters to find specific logs by system, stage, record type (field/lab), or date range. Great for focused analysis!

table.title: Daily Logs Table
table.content: View all your logs with key details: type, date, system, period, laboratory, recorded by, and number of entries. Alerts show if any parameters are out of range. Click any row to see full details.

pagination.title: Navigation
pagination.content: Navigate through multiple pages of logs and adjust how many records are shown per page.

complete.title: Daily Logs Mastered!
complete.content: You now know how to manage daily logs effectively. Start recording your water treatment data to keep track of system performance!

new.title: Create Daily Log Tour
new.description: Learn how to record field measurements and laboratory results

welcome.title: Record a New Daily Log!
welcome.content: This form helps you record daily water treatment data - either field measurements taken on-site or laboratory analysis results. Let's walk through it!

header.title: New Log Form
header.content: This page lets you create a new daily log entry. You can record field measurements or laboratory analysis for any of your systems.

actionButtons.title: Save or Cancel
actionButtons.content: Use these buttons to save your daily log when you're done, or cancel to go back without saving changes.

recordType.title: Record Type
recordType.content: Choose between Field Record (measurements taken on-site) or Laboratory Record (analysis performed in a lab). This determines which fields you'll need to fill.

systemSelection.title: Select System
systemSelection.content: Choose which water treatment system you're recording data for. If the system has stages, you can optionally select a specific stage.

datePeriod.title: Date and Period
datePeriod.content: Enter the date of the measurement and optionally specify the period (morning, afternoon, etc.). You can also add the exact time if needed.

monitoringValues.title: Enter Measurements
monitoringValues.content: Record values for each monitoring point. You'll see the parameter name, unit, and acceptable range. Enter at least one value to save the log. Out-of-range values will trigger alerts!

complete.title: Ready to Record!
complete.content: You now know how to create daily logs. Fill in the required information and monitoring values, then click Save to record your data!

detail.title: Daily Log Details Tour
detail.description: Learn how to review daily log entries and monitoring values

welcome.title: View Daily Log Details!
welcome.content: This page shows complete details of a daily log entry, including all monitoring values and their status. Let's explore what information is available!

header.title: Log Overview
header.content: See the log type (field/laboratory), date, and system name at a glance. This gives you quick context about the record you're viewing.

recordInfo.title: Record Information
recordInfo.content: View all details about this log: record type, system, date, period, time, and who recorded it. For laboratory records, you'll also see the lab name and collection details. The status badge alerts you if any parameters are out of range.

monitoringEntries.title: Monitoring Values
monitoringEntries.content: See all recorded measurements with their monitoring point, value, expected range, and status. Out-of-range values are highlighted in red with a danger badge, making it easy to spot issues that need attention!

complete.title: Details Reviewed!
complete.content: You now know how to review daily log details. Use this page to analyze recorded data, check for out-of-range values, and ensure system performance is on track!

list.title: Incidents Tour
list.description: Learn how to manage and track incidents in your water treatment systems

welcome.title: Welcome to Incidents!
welcome.content: Incidents help you track and resolve issues that occur in your water treatment systems. Let's explore how to manage them effectively!

header.title: Incidents Page
header.content: This page shows all reported incidents with their priority, status, and assignments. You can view, filter, and export incident reports from here.

viewMode.title: View Mode Toggle
viewMode.content: Switch between table view (detailed list) and chart view (visual graphs) to analyze incidents in different ways. Charts help identify patterns and trends!

export.title: Export Your Data
export.content: Export incident reports to PDF, HTML, or CSV format for documentation, compliance, or offline analysis.

reportButton.title: Report New Incident
reportButton.content: Click here to report a new incident. You can document issues, set priority levels, and assign them to team members for resolution.

filters.title: Filter Incidents
filters.content: Use filters to find specific incidents by system, stage, status, priority, or date range. Great for tracking resolution progress!

table.title: Incidents Table
table.content: View all incidents with key details: title, system, priority, status, reporter, and creation date. Color-coded badges make it easy to spot critical issues. Click any row to see full details.

complete.title: Incidents Mastered!
complete.content: You now know how to manage incidents effectively. Start tracking and resolving issues to maintain optimal system performance!

new.title: Report Incident Tour
new.description: Learn how to report and document incidents in your systems

welcome.title: Report a New Incident!
welcome.content: This form helps you document issues that occur in your water treatment systems. Let's walk through how to report an incident!

header.title: New Incident Form
header.content: This page lets you report a new incident. You can describe the issue, set priority, and assign it to team members for resolution.

actionButtons.title: Save or Cancel
actionButtons.content: Use these buttons to submit your incident report when you're done, or cancel to go back without saving changes.

basicInfo.title: Basic Information
basicInfo.content: Enter the incident title, select the affected system, set priority level (critical, high, medium, low), and choose the current status. Priority helps team members address critical issues first!

description.title: Incident Description
description.content: Provide a detailed description of the incident. Include what happened, when it occurred, and any observations. Clear descriptions help with faster resolution!

assignment.title: Assignment & Tracking
assignment.content: Optionally assign the incident to a team member for resolution. You can also add notes about steps taken or additional context.

complete.title: Ready to Report!
complete.content: You now know how to report incidents. Fill in the required information and click Submit to create the incident report!

detail.title: Incident Details Tour
detail.description: Learn how to review incident details and track resolution progress

welcome.title: View Incident Details!
welcome.content: This page shows complete details of an incident, including its description, status, assignment, and resolution information. Let's explore what's available!

header.title: Incident Overview
header.content: See the incident title, priority, and status at a glance. Color-coded badges help you quickly identify the severity and current state.

incidentInfo.title: Incident Information
incidentInfo.content: View all details about this incident: system, priority, status, reporter, assignee, creation date, and full description. This gives you complete context about the issue.

resolution.title: Resolution Details
resolution.content: See resolution information including when the incident was resolved, who resolved it, and resolution notes. For open incidents, you can update the status and add resolution notes here.

complete.title: Details Reviewed!
complete.content: You now know how to review incident details and track resolution progress. Use this page to monitor issues and ensure they're addressed promptly!

list.title: Inspections Tour
list.description: Learn how to manage and track system inspections

welcome.title: Welcome to Inspections!
welcome.content: Inspections help you ensure your water treatment systems are operating correctly through systematic checks. Let's explore how to manage them!

header.title: Inspections Page
header.content: This page shows all inspections with their status, results, and completion details. You can view, filter, and export inspection reports from here.

viewMode.title: View Mode Toggle
viewMode.content: Switch between table view (detailed list) and chart view (visual graphs) to analyze inspection data in different ways. Charts help identify compliance trends!

export.title: Export Your Data
export.content: Export inspection reports to PDF, HTML, or CSV format for documentation, compliance records, or offline analysis.

newInspection.title: Create New Inspection
newInspection.content: Click here to perform a new inspection. You'll complete a checklist of items to verify your system is operating within specifications.

filters.title: Filter Inspections
filters.content: Use filters to find specific inspections by system, stage, status, or date range. Great for reviewing compliance history!

table.title: Inspections Table
table.content: View all inspections with key details: date, system, inspector, status, and item results (conforming/non-conforming). Click any row to see full details and photos.

complete.title: Inspections Mastered!
complete.content: You now know how to manage inspections effectively. Regular inspections help maintain system compliance and identify issues early!

new.title: Create Inspection Tour
new.description: Learn how to perform and document system inspections

welcome.title: Perform a New Inspection!
welcome.content: This form guides you through a systematic inspection of your water treatment system. Let's walk through the checklist process!

header.title: New Inspection Form
header.content: This page lets you create a new inspection record. You'll complete a checklist of items to verify system compliance.

actionButtons.title: Save or Cancel
actionButtons.content: Use these buttons to save your inspection when you're done, or cancel to go back without saving changes.

basicInfo.title: Inspection Details
basicInfo.content: Select the system to inspect and set the inspection date. If the system has stages, you can optionally select a specific stage to focus on.

checklistItems.title: Checklist Items
checklistItems.content: Go through each checklist item and mark it as Conforme (C), Non-Conforme (NC), or Not Applicable (NA). Add observations and photos for non-conforming items to document issues.

conclusion.title: Inspection Conclusion
conclusion.content: Add your overall conclusion and any general observations about the inspection. This provides context for the results.

complete.title: Ready to Complete!
complete.content: You now know how to perform inspections. Complete all checklist items and click Save to record your inspection!

detail.title: Inspection Details Tour
detail.description: Learn how to review inspection results and findings

welcome.title: View Inspection Results!
welcome.content: This page shows complete details of an inspection, including all checklist items, their status, photos, and observations. Let's explore the results!

header.title: Inspection Overview
header.content: See the inspection date, system, and status at a glance. This gives you quick context about the inspection you're reviewing.

inspectionInfo.title: Inspection Information
inspectionInfo.content: View all details about this inspection: date, system, stage, inspector, status, and conclusion. This provides complete context about when and how the inspection was performed.

checklistResults.title: Checklist Results
checklistResults.content: See all checklist items with their status (Conforme/Non-Conforme/NA), observations, and photos. Non-conforming items are highlighted to make issues easy to spot. Click on items to see full details and photos!

complete.title: Results Reviewed!
complete.content: You now know how to review inspection details. Use this page to verify compliance, track non-conforming items, and ensure corrective actions are taken!

dashboard.title: Dashboard Tour
dashboard.description: Learn how to use the main dashboard and understand key metrics

welcome.title: Welcome to LINCE!
welcome.content: Let's take a quick tour of your dashboard. You'll learn how to view statistics, monitor recent activity, and track alerts. Click 'Next' to begin.

header.title: Dashboard Header
header.content: This is your dashboard header showing the current view and your user information. You can see a personalized welcome message here.

viewMode.title: View Mode Toggle
viewMode.content: Switch between table view (detailed lists) and chart view (visual graphs) to see your data in different formats. Try clicking this button!

export.title: Export Options
export.content: Export your dashboard data to PDF, HTML, or CSV formats for reports and record-keeping. Perfect for sharing with your team or keeping archives.

stats.title: Statistics Overview
stats.content: These cards show key metrics for your water treatment systems: total systems, daily logs, inspections, incidents, and alerts. Monitor everything at a glance!

recentActivity.title: Recent Activity
recentActivity.content: View your most recent daily logs, inspections, and incidents in one place. Click any item to see more details.

alerts.title: Active Alerts
alerts.content: Critical alerts and notifications appear here. Keep an eye on out-of-range parameters, low stock items, and unread notifications.

sidebar.title: Main Navigation
sidebar.content: Use the sidebar to navigate between different sections: Daily Logs, Inspections, Incidents, Systems, Reports, and more. All your tools are just one click away!

complete.title: You're All Set!
complete.content: Great job! You now know the basics of the dashboard. Explore other sections to learn more, or click 'Finish' to start using LINCE.

list.title: Clients Management Tour
list.description: Learn how to manage your clients and their information

welcome.title: Welcome to Client Management!
welcome.content: This tour will show you how to manage clients, add new ones, and keep track of all client information. Let's get started!

header.title: Clients Page Header
header.content: See an overview of your client management section. The header shows the total number of clients you're managing.

addButton.title: Add New Client
addButton.content: Click here to add a new client. You'll be able to enter all their information including name, contact details, and address.

search.title: Search Clients
search.content: Quickly find clients by typing their name, email, or phone number. The results update as you type!

table.title: Clients Table
table.content: View all your clients in this organized table. You can see their name, contact person, email, phone, and current status. Click any row to view full details.

actions.title: Client Actions
actions.content: Click the menu icon to edit client information, manage their users, or delete the client if needed.

pagination.title: Pagination
pagination.content: Navigate through multiple pages of clients and adjust how many clients are shown per page.

complete.title: Client Management Mastered!
complete.content: You now know how to manage your clients effectively. Try adding a new client or exploring their details!

add.title: Add Client Tour
add.description: Step-by-step guide to adding a new client

welcome.title: Let's Add a New Client!
welcome.content: This form will help you register a new client with all their essential information. We'll guide you through each section.

form.title: Client Information Form
form.content: Fill out this form with your client's details. All required fields are marked with an asterisk (*).

basicInfo.title: Basic Information
basicInfo.content: Enter the client's name and select whether they are currently active. You can also upload a logo if available.

contactInfo.title: Contact Information
contactInfo.content: Provide contact details including the contact person's name, email, phone, and physical address for the client.

submit.title: Save Client
submit.content: Once you've filled in all the required information, click here to save the new client. You'll be redirected to the client details page.

complete.title: Client Addition Complete!
complete.content: Great! You now know how to add new clients. Make sure to keep their information up to date.

detail.title: Client Details Tour
detail.description: Explore client details and management options

welcome.title: Client Details Page!
welcome.content: Here you can view and manage all information about this client. Let's explore what you can do.

header.title: Client Header
header.content: View the client's name, logo, and status at a glance. This header provides quick identification.

info.title: Client Information
info.content: See all the client's details including contact information, address, and other important data organized in sections.

edit.title: Edit Client
edit.content: Click here to modify any of the client's information. You can update contact details, status, or upload a new logo.

users.title: Manage Users
users.content: Add, edit, or remove users associated with this client. Control who has access to their systems and data.

complete.title: Client Details Explored!
complete.content: You're now familiar with the client details page. Keep your client information accurate and up to date!

users.title: Client Users Tour
users.description: Learn how to manage user access to clients

welcome.title: Client User Management!
welcome.content: Control who has access to this client and their permission levels. Let's see how it works!

header.title: Users Page Header
header.content: View the client name and manage all users who have access to this client's data.

addButton.title: Add User Access
addButton.content: Click here to grant a user access to this client. You can select from available users and set their access level.

table.title: Users Table
table.content: See all users who have access to this client, their roles, and current access levels. You can modify permissions or remove access from here.

accessLevel.title: Access Levels
accessLevel.content: Change user access levels: View Only (read-only), Edit (create & modify data), or Admin (full access including user management).

complete.title: User Management Complete!
complete.content: You now know how to control user access to clients. Keep permissions up to date for security!

firstSetup.title: First Client Setup Tour
firstSetup.description: Welcome! Let's add your first client to get started

welcome.title: Welcome to LINCE!
welcome.content: Great to have you here! Before you can start managing water treatment systems, you need to add your first client. This quick tour will guide you through the process.

header.title: Getting Started
header.content: This page helps you add your first client. A client represents an organization or location you'll be managing water treatment systems for.

form.title: Client Information Form
form.content: Fill out this simple form with your client's basic information. Only the client name is required to get started - you can always add more details later.

requiredFields.title: Client Name (Required)
requiredFields.content: Enter the name of your client. This is the only required field. The client name will appear throughout the system when you're managing their water treatment systems.

contactFields.title: Contact Information (Optional)
contactFields.content: Add contact details like address, contact person, phone, and email. These are optional but helpful for keeping all client information in one place.

submit.title: Add Client & Continue
submit.content: Once you've entered at least the client name, click here to save your first client and continue to the dashboard. You'll be able to add more clients later!

complete.title: You're All Set!
complete.content: Perfect! You now know how to add your first client. Once you submit this form, you'll be taken to the dashboard where you can start managing water treatment systems.

list.title: Products Inventory Tour
list.description: Learn how to manage chemical products and inventory

welcome.title: Welcome to Product Management!
welcome.content: Manage your water treatment chemical inventory here. Track stock levels, set low-stock alerts, and monitor product usage across all systems. Let's explore!

header.title: Products Page
header.content: This page shows your complete product inventory. View all chemicals, their current stock levels, suppliers, and low-stock alerts.

viewMode.title: View Mode Toggle
viewMode.content: Switch between table view (detailed product list) and chart view (visual inventory analysis) to manage your stock effectively.

export.title: Export Inventory
export.content: Export your product inventory to PDF, HTML, or CSV format for procurement, audits, or reporting purposes.

addProduct.title: Add New Product
addProduct.content: Click here to add a new chemical product to your inventory. Enter details like name, type, unit, supplier, and stock levels.

filters.title: Filter Products
filters.content: Filter products by system, type, or show only low-stock items. Perfect for procurement planning and inventory checks!

table.title: Products Table
table.content: View all products with current stock, minimum alert levels, status (in stock/low stock), and supplier information. Click any row to see detailed usage history and manage stock.

complete.title: Inventory Management Ready!
complete.content: You now know how to manage your chemical inventory. Keep track of stock levels to ensure your water treatment never runs out of essential products!

form.title: Add/Edit Product Tour
form.description: Learn how to add and configure products in your inventory

welcome.title: Adding a New Product
welcome.content: Let's walk through adding a new chemical product to your inventory. You'll set up all the details needed for effective stock management.

name.title: Product Name
name.content: Enter the product name (e.g., 'Sodium Hypochlorite', 'PAC', 'Lime'). Use clear, consistent names for easy identification.

type.title: Product Type
type.content: Select the product type (e.g., Coagulant, Disinfectant, pH Corrector). This helps categorize and filter products.

unit.title: Unit of Measurement
unit.content: Choose the unit for measuring this product (kg, L, mL, g, etc.). This will be used for all stock tracking and usage records.

stock.title: Stock Levels
stock.content: Enter the current stock quantity and minimum alert level. When stock falls below the minimum, you'll receive low-stock warnings.

supplier.title: Supplier & Dosage Info
supplier.content: Add supplier information and recommended dosage guidelines. This helps with procurement and proper product usage.

complete.title: Product Configured!
complete.content: Great! You've learned how to add products to your inventory. Fill out the form and save to add your first product.

detail.title: Product Details Tour
detail.description: Learn how to manage stock and track product usage

welcome.title: Product Detail Page
welcome.content: This page shows complete product information, stock levels, usage history, and dosage configurations. Let's explore how to manage it!

header.title: Product Header
header.content: See the product name and type. Quick access to all product information and management actions.

actions.title: Stock Management Actions
actions.content: Update stock levels (add/remove), record product usage in systems, or delete the product if no longer needed.

info.title: Product Information
info.content: View current stock, minimum alert level, stock status, supplier, recommended dosage, and product description. All key details at a glance!

history.title: Usage History
history.content: Track every stock movement: when products were used, in which systems, quantities, who recorded it, and any notes. Complete audit trail!

dosage.title: Dosage Configurations
dosage.content: Configure automatic dosage calculations for different systems. Set dosage formulas based on flow rate, volume, or other parameters.

complete.title: Product Management Mastered!
complete.content: You now know how to manage product stock and track usage. Keep your inventory updated for smooth water treatment operations!

workflow.title: Reports Module Overview
workflow.description: Learn about the complete reports workflow and features

welcome.title: Welcome to Reports!
welcome.content: Generate comprehensive water treatment reports with templates, data visualization, and AI-powered insights. Let's explore the reports module!

header.title: Reports Page
header.content: This is the central hub for all reporting activities. Create new reports, manage templates, and view your report history all in one place.

tabs.title: Report Tabs
tabs.content: Three powerful tabs: Generator (create reports), Templates (customize report layouts), and History (view past reports). Each tab is designed for specific reporting tasks.

complete.title: Reports Ready!
complete.content: You now understand the reports workflow. Explore each tab to master report generation, template management, and report history!

generator.title: Report Generator Tour
generator.description: Learn how to generate comprehensive water treatment reports

welcome.title: Generate Your First Report!
welcome.content: The report generator guides you through creating professional reports with data from your systems. Follow the step-by-step process to create your report!

stepper.title: Report Generation Steps
stepper.content: This stepper shows your progress through 5 steps: Template, Period, Systems, Options, and Preview. Complete each step to generate your report.

template.title: Select Template
template.content: Choose a report template that defines the structure and sections of your report. You can use default templates or create custom ones in the Templates tab.

period.title: Select Period
period.content: Choose the reporting period: daily, weekly, monthly, or custom date range. This determines which data will be included in your report.

systems.title: Select Systems
systems.content: Choose which water treatment systems to include in the report. You can select multiple systems to create comprehensive reports covering all your operations.

options.title: Report Options
options.content: Configure report options: include only alerts, add photos, generate charts, select monitoring points, and add AI-generated conclusions with signature fields.

preview.title: Preview & Edit
preview.content: Preview your report before generating the final PDF. Review all sections, edit the AI-generated conclusion, and add signature information.

actions.title: Save & Share
actions.content: Once satisfied with the preview, save to database, download as PDF/Word, or send via email. Your report will also appear in the History tab.

complete.title: Report Generation Mastered!
complete.content: You now know how to generate professional water treatment reports. Practice creating reports for different periods and systems!

templates.title: Report Templates Tour
templates.description: Learn how to create and manage custom report templates

welcome.title: Customize Your Reports!
welcome.content: Report templates define the structure, sections, and branding of your reports. Create custom templates to match your organization's needs!

create.title: Create New Template
create.content: Click here to create a new report template. You'll define sections, headers, footers, and customize the appearance of your reports.

grid.title: Templates Grid
grid.content: View all your report templates. Each card shows the template name, description, sections, and whether it's set as default.

card.title: Template Actions
card.content: Edit templates to customize sections, duplicate templates to create variations, set default template for quick access, or delete unused templates.

complete.title: Templates Management Mastered!
complete.content: You now know how to manage report templates. Create templates tailored to different report types and regulatory requirements!

history.title: Report History Tour
history.description: Learn how to view and manage previously generated reports

welcome.title: Access Your Report Archive!
welcome.content: The report history shows all previously generated reports. Download, view, or delete old reports as needed for compliance and record-keeping.

filters.title: Filter Reports
filters.content: Filter reports by date range to quickly find specific reports. Perfect for audit preparation or reviewing historical data!

refresh.title: Refresh List
refresh.content: Click refresh to update the report list and see newly generated reports. The list updates automatically but manual refresh ensures the latest data.

table.title: Reports Table
table.content: View all generated reports with details: name, period, systems covered, generated date, creator, and PDF availability. Click any row or use the menu to download PDF/Word or delete.

complete.title: History Management Mastered!
complete.content: You now know how to access and manage your report archive. Keep organized records for compliance and historical analysis!

list.title: Systems Management Tour
list.description: Learn how to manage water treatment systems

welcome.title: Welcome to Systems!
welcome.content: Manage your water treatment systems here. Define systems, configure monitoring points, create inspection checklists, and track system status. Let's explore!

header.title: Systems Page
header.content: This page shows all your water treatment systems and stages. Systems are the main treatment units, and stages represent specific sections within a system.

viewMode.title: View Mode Toggle
viewMode.content: Switch between table view (detailed system list) and chart view (visual system analysis) to manage your infrastructure effectively.

export.title: Export Systems
export.content: Export your systems list to PDF, HTML, or CSV format for documentation, reporting, or offline reference.

addSystem.title: Add New System
addSystem.content: Click here to add a new water treatment system or stage. Enter details like name, location, type, capacity, and status.

table.title: Systems Table
table.content: View all your systems and stages with details: name, location, type, status, and creation date. Click any row to see full system details, monitoring points, and checklists.

complete.title: Systems Management Ready!
complete.content: You now know how to manage water treatment systems. Add systems, configure monitoring, and track operational status!

detail.title: System Details Tour
detail.description: Learn about system information and management options

welcome.title: System Detail Page
welcome.content: This page shows complete system information, monitoring configuration, inspection checklists, and photo documentation. Let's explore!

header.title: System Header
header.content: See the system name, type, and current status. Quick access to all system information and management features.

actions.title: System Actions
actions.content: Edit system details, delete the system (with safety checks for related records), or navigate back to the systems list.

info.title: System Information
info.content: View complete system details: location, type, capacity, operating hours, installation date, status, responsible person, description, and parent system (if it's a stage).

photos.title: Photo Gallery
photos.content: View photos of the system for documentation and reference. Upload new photos to maintain visual records of your infrastructure.

complete.title: System Details Mastered!
complete.content: You now understand system details. Continue to learn about monitoring points and checklists for complete system management!

monitoringPoints.title: Monitoring Points Tour
monitoringPoints.description: Learn how to configure monitoring points for daily logs

welcome.title: Monitoring Points Configuration
welcome.content: Monitoring points define the parameters you track in daily logs. Configure points for pH, chlorine, turbidity, flow rate, and other water quality metrics!

section.title: Monitoring Points Section
section.content: This section shows all monitoring points configured for this system. Each point links to a parameter (what you measure) and unit (how you measure it).

add.title: Add Monitoring Point
add.content: Click here to add a new monitoring point. Select the parameter, unit, set normal ranges (min/max), and configure alert thresholds for out-of-range values.

table.title: Monitoring Points Table
table.content: View all monitoring points with parameter, unit, normal ranges, alert thresholds, and actions. Edit points to adjust ranges or delete unused points.

complete.title: Monitoring Configuration Complete!
complete.content: You now know how to configure monitoring points. These points will appear in daily logs for data entry and tracking!

checklist.title: Inspection Checklist Tour
checklist.description: Learn how to create inspection checklist items

welcome.title: Inspection Checklist Setup
welcome.content: Inspection checklists define the items operators check during inspections. Create comprehensive checklists for equipment checks, safety verification, and compliance items!

section.title: Checklist Section
section.content: This section shows all checklist items configured for this system. Each item will appear in inspection forms for operators to mark as Conforme (OK) or NÃ£o Conforme (Not OK).

add.title: Add Checklist Item
add.content: Click here to add a new checklist item. Enter the item description and set the display order. Items appear in inspections in the order you define.

table.title: Checklist Items Table
table.content: View all checklist items with descriptions and order. Edit items to change text or reorder them, or delete items that are no longer needed.

complete.title: Checklist Configuration Complete!
complete.content: You now know how to create inspection checklists. These items will guide operators through systematic inspections!

notifications.title: Notifications Tour
notifications.description: Learn how to manage and create system notifications

welcome.title: Welcome to Notifications!
welcome.content: Stay informed with system alerts, incident notifications, stock warnings, and custom messages. Learn how to manage your notifications effectively!

header.title: Notifications Page
header.content: This page shows all your notifications with unread count. Stay on top of important alerts, incidents, low stock warnings, and system updates.

export.title: Export Notifications
export.content: Export your notification history to PDF, HTML, or CSV format for record-keeping, audits, or offline review.

create.title: Create Custom Notification
create.content: Admins and managers can create custom notifications to send messages to all users, specific roles, or individual users. Perfect for announcements and important updates!

tabs.title: Notification Tabs
tabs.content: Switch between 'My Notifications' (messages you received) and 'All Notifications' (admin view of all system notifications with delivery stats).

myNotifications.title: My Notifications List
myNotifications.content: View all your notifications with priority indicators, read/unread status, and quick actions. Click notifications related to incidents, daily logs, or products to jump to the relevant page.

actions.title: Notification Actions
actions.content: Mark all as read to clear unread indicators, or clear all notifications to remove them from your list. Keep your notification center organized!

complete.title: Notifications Mastered!
complete.content: You now know how to manage notifications and stay informed about system events. Never miss important alerts or updates!

profile.title: Profile Tour
profile.description: Learn how to manage your personal profile and security settings

welcome.title: Welcome to Your Profile!
welcome.content: Your profile page lets you manage your personal information, update your avatar, and change your password. Keep your account secure and up-to-date!

header.title: Profile Page
header.content: This page contains all your account settings divided into two sections: profile information and password management.

profileInfo.title: Profile Information Card
profileInfo.content: View and edit your personal details including name, email, phone, role, and account status. Your profile information is visible to other users in the system.

avatar.title: Avatar Upload
avatar.content: Click the camera icon to upload a profile picture. Supports JPG, PNG, GIF, and WebP formats up to 10MB. Your avatar appears throughout the system!

details.title: Account Details
details.content: View your email, phone, account status, last login time, and member since date. This information helps you track your account activity and status.

editButton.title: Edit Profile
editButton.content: Click this button to edit your name, email, and phone number. Make sure your contact information is current for system notifications and communication!

password.title: Password Change Section
password.content: Change your password regularly to keep your account secure. You'll need your current password and must confirm the new password. Minimum 6 characters required.

complete.title: Profile Management Complete!
complete.content: You now know how to manage your profile information and security settings. Keep your profile updated and your password strong!

list.title: Document Library Tour
list.description: Learn how to manage and organize your document library

welcome.title: Welcome to the Document Library!
welcome.content: Store and manage all your water treatment documents in one place - manuals, SOPs, datasheets, reports, and more. Let's explore how to organize your library!

header.title: Library Page
header.content: This page is your central document repository. Upload, search, filter, and access all documents related to your water treatment systems.

upload.title: Upload Documents
upload.content: Click here to upload new documents. You can add manuals, SOPs, datasheets, reports, and link them to specific systems for easy organization.

search.title: Search and Filter
search.content: Use the search bar to find documents by name, and filter by category (manual, SOP, datasheet, report) to quickly locate what you need.

table.title: Documents Table
table.content: View all your documents with details like category, related system, file type, version, and last update. Click any row to view full document details and download.

complete.title: Library Management Mastered!
complete.content: You now know how to manage your document library. Keep your documents organized and easily accessible for your team!

upload.title: Document Upload Tour
upload.description: Learn how to upload and organize new documents

welcome.title: Upload a New Document!
welcome.content: Follow these steps to upload and properly categorize your documents for easy retrieval later.

title.title: Document Title
title.content: Enter a clear, descriptive title for the document. This helps your team quickly identify what the document contains.

category.title: Select Category
category.content: Choose the document type: Manual (equipment guides), SOP (standard procedures), Datasheet (technical specs), Report (analysis results), or Other (custom category).

system.title: Link to System
system.content: Optionally link this document to a specific water treatment system. This makes it easier to find system-related documentation. You can also select a specific stage if needed.

description.title: Add Description
description.content: Provide a brief description of the document contents. This helps team members understand what's inside before downloading.

file.title: Upload File
file.content: Select the file to upload. Supports PDF, Office documents (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), and images (JPG, PNG). The system automatically tracks versions.

complete.title: Upload Process Complete!
complete.content: You now know how to upload and organize documents. Keep your library up-to-date with the latest manuals, procedures, and reports!
